reviewText:
The movies were awesome, great family movies.  My only issue was with the cheap quality of the package and the disc, every time I opened the case and pulled out the DVD I was afraid I was going to break the disc.  But I didn't pay much for it so I can't complain a whole lot.

Buy the movies definitely, but maybe spent a couple of extra dollars on a nicer edition.

This Jimmy Durante double feature consists of public domain comedies. Often, budget label purveyors of such movies dub from somewhat degraded 16mm TV films or VHS tapes of similarly-preserved transfers. Quality usually depends on source material rareness. Both of these are widely available works. In PALOOKA, Jimmy is fight manager Knobby Walsh opposite Stuart Erwin as 1930's comic strip character Joe Palooka. Other cast members include Lupe Velez (MEXICAN SPITFIRE - 1940), Robert Armstrong (KING KONG - 1933), Thelma Todd (THE MALTESE FALCON - 1931), and Jimmy Cagney's kid brother, William. (Note: After this initial outing, Joe Palooka became a series of 19 films. Shemp Howard portrayed Knobby in 7 of these. James Gleason and Leon Errol also played Joe's manager. THE GREAT RUPERT is a charming family Christmas time movie about what had to be the smartest squirrel of all time. George Pal quite effectively animated Jimmy's furry little friend, even making him dance. Other highlights of this cute picture include Durante's versions of a few Xmas songs. Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website. (6.6) The Great Rupert (1950) - Jimmy Durante/Terry Moore/Tom Drake/Frank Orth/Sara Haden/Queenie Smith/Chick Chandler/Jimmy Conlin/Candy Candido/Frank Cady (5.8) Palooka (1934) - Jimmy Durante/Lupe Velez/Stuart Erwin/Marjorie Rambeau/Robert Armstrong/Mary Carlisle/William Cagney/Thelma Todd/Louise Beavers/Fred 'Snowflake' Toones (uncredited: Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams)
